definition: carnival
mad/wild/violent
joyous/happy/pleased
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: And what do those visiting Karneval dress up as? Everything imaginable.
sentences.chinese: 看看這些科隆狂歡節參與者的打扮，發揮你的想象吧。

sentences.english: Bret : These movies were indebted to the carnival and the freak show.
sentences.chinese: 此類電影應該算是得益於狂歡節及怪誕異常的表演。

sentences.english: Carnival of Carnivals will bring together examples of carnivals from interested towns.
sentences.chinese: 狂歡節的展品可以提供給其他感興趣的城市模範作用。

sentences.english: New Orleans hosts the United States' most notorious Mardi Gras festivities.
sentences.chinese: 新奧爾良主辦美國最臭名昭著的四旬齋前狂歡節。

sentences.english: There the Carnival forms part of politics.
sentences.chinese: 狂歡節是政治的一部分。

sentences.english: The image was taken during the Carnival in the town of Jacmel, Haiti.
sentences.chinese: 該圖像是獲得在狂歡節期間的雅克梅勒鎮，海地。

sentences.english: The image was taken during the Carnival in the town of Jacmel, Haiti .
sentences.chinese: 這張照片是在海地雅克梅勒鎮狂歡節期間拍攝的。

sentences.english: And one year, I went to New Orleans for Mardi Gras.
sentences.chinese: 有一年，我去新奧爾良參加狂歡節。

sentences.english: The carnival is the final big party before the penitential season of Lent begins.
sentences.chinese: 狂歡節是四旬齋之前的最後狂歡盛會。

sentences.english: Hallowtide had a little of the atmosphere of Carnival or Mardi Gras.
sentences.chinese: 萬聖季的氣氛有一點像嘉年華或懺悔星期二的狂歡節。

sentences.english: I got some good shots of the carnival.
sentences.chinese: 我有幾個狂歡節的精彩鏡頭。

sentences.english: But it's not just German politicians who get the Karneval treatment.
sentences.chinese: 不光是德國政治家被捲進了科隆狂歡節。

sentences.english: Venice becomes even more enchanting during Carnival.
sentences.chinese: 狂歡節上的威尼斯尤其迷人。

sentences.english: Tessa and Bill are at the Winter Carnival in Quebec City.
sentences.chinese: 特薩和比爾正在魁北克市冬季狂歡節的現場。

sentences.english: The scaffold forms part of the fte.
sentences.chinese: 斷頭臺是狂歡節必不可少的一部分。

sentences.english: A kind of carnival, a carnivale, a Mardi Gras, where a festival is going on.
sentences.chinese: 一種嘉年華，狂歡節，慶典舉行的所在。

definition: to beat the gong to open a performance
see 光棍節|光棍节[Guang1 gun4 jie2]
flag raising ceremony

a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
circus

Arbor Day (March 12th), also known as National Tree Planting Day 全民義務植樹日|全民义务植树日[Quan2 min2 Yi4 wu4 Zhi2 shu4 ri4]
to deliver (a diploma, licence etc)/to qualify
horse race/horse racing
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
